Research Group - Theoretical Models of Eco-Evolutionary Dynamics

Department of Evolutionary Theory, Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Biology

Find Out More

Interactions are life!

Evolution proceeding at ecological time scales changes the way we approach traditional evolutionary dynamics. We are interested in understanding the evolutionary change in interactions in the light of the ecology in which they take place. The focal individuals of interest could be at any level of organisation, from chemical reactants to memes and interactions can take different forms from cooperation to conflict. With such a broad perspective our work spans from the traditional fields of theoretical ecology and population genetics to evolutionary games and social evolution.

Currently the Group consists of

Vandana Maria

Chaitanya

Research Interest

Mutualism

How mutualisms are initiated and what keeps them from breaking down?

Antagonism

Host-pathogen co-evolution, antibiotic resistance and classical predator prey dynamics

Evolutionary dynamics

Evolutionary dynamics via game theory and theoretical ecology, a trove of mathematical tools.

Population Genetics

Focusing on the knowledge transfer between EGT and Population Genetics!

We are in Plön

Embedded in the Department of Evolutionary Theory at the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Biology

We are nestled in the tourist town of Plön, in the northernmost state of Germany.
